p: In round 2, six diazo substrates were exploited: the four substrates identified in round 1, and two additional substrates ( A11 and A12) that had not yielded bioactive products. The six substrates were each treated with a metal catalyst (8 alternatives) in a specific solvent (4 alternatives). The crude product mixtures were scavenged and evaporated as before, and screened at tenfold lower concentration (total product concentration: 1 μM; Figure 2b, middle). It was observed that the most active product mixtures stemmed from two of the substrates ( A1 and A3) in combination with dirhodium carboxylate catalysts.
